answerText: keratin[10] Keratin filaments are one example of these cytoskeletal structures. Other examples of them are made of GFAP or vimentin, and they have an average diameter around 10 nanometers.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 3 | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Mutations in one form of this protein cause epidermolysis bullosa simplex.  [10] Name this common protein found in hair and nails, which consists of a coiled-coil dimer held together by hydrophobic interactions.
